channel.title: HTC Desire HD or iPhone 4?
channel.description:
That time of year has come where I have to get a new contract, coming from a Nokia 5530 this is quite a jump, though she was good back in its day.
I've read reviews, watched videos, but still cannot make my mind up. Best features of each phone? discuss etc.
fyi, I much prefer the look of the iPhone, but I'm prepared to ditch looks for hardware any day. I'm in the UK, and network preferences would be either Three or Orange, swaying more towards Orange.

item.title: HTC Desire HD or iPhone 4?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Brolapse, post:4, topic:404722”]I got a desire hd back in october and I’ve loved it ever since, I haven’t had a single app that has lagged and the large screen makes playing games awesome, the camera is great too you can get some really good photos with it. One thing I hate about iphones is you can’t change the storage, the desire hd comes with an 8gb minisd card. Even though it has a large screen it fits really nicely in my pocket. I paid about £300 for it and am on a contract with t mobile for £10 a month which gets me 100 minutes, unlimited texts and basically unlimited internet(Says 1.5gb a month but they wont charge if I go over, which I’ve never managed to do)

Definitely go for that over an iphone 4. I haven’t looked in to the Galaxy S II but if it’s got better specs than the desire hd then go for it.[/quote]
Sounds good, cheers I’d be sure to get at least 16gb SD card anyway, I’m a big music fan.

[quote=“Speljohan, post:5, topic:404722”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=501736.msg3670862#msg3670862 date=1310920696]

I wouldn’t buy an iPhone 4 now given how it is due for an upgrade within the next month or two. HTC Desire HD has been out for a while too, if you’re looking for an Android alternative to that - why not take a look at the Samsung Galaxy S II?

Seems like a decent phone yeah, college lecturer has the first galaxy s, though, does it have the stupid headphone jack that all samsungs seem to have, where it needs a connector to plug the standard 3.5mm headphones in?

edit: nvm, found it in the wikipedia page, standard 3.5mm slot. hm, no contracts on carphone warehouse
Wow the reviews are great for it, besides the battery, only thing is that it’s 100 quid more than the Desire HD, worth it?
[/quote]Why would you get one with a contract? It’s a fuckton more expensive in the long run.[/quote]
Oh? Find me a good deal, must have unl. texts, 200+ minutes and just a little internet, don’t mind if it’s just 250mb.
It’s like 500 quid unlocked, plus the pay monthly sim would be £10+ a month.

I can’t imagine that being a huge amount better than what’s here: http://shop.orange.co.uk/mobile-phones/plans/planDetails.jsp?bbPlanId=&updateBasket=&notbbPlanId=&pagefrom=&id=sku4190029
Thinking about the panther 30.
